paragraphs.text: In the UK, we also can't breathe.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: A member of the "United Friends and Families Campaign" spoke to protesters about some of these cases, including that of a 40-year-old mother, Joy Gardner
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Her only relation to Eric Garner, he explained, is that she, too, couldn't breathe after 13 feet of tape was wrapped in at least seven complete turns around her head
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: She fell into a coma and was pronounced dead four days later
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Azelle Rodney, 24, was killed in 2005
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He was shot six times within two seconds of police officers ramming the vehicle in which he was travelling
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: His body was then left on the pavement for 16 hours - not unlike Mike Brown in the streets of Ferguson
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Only after nearly 10 years of campaigning led by Rodney's mother, Susan Alexander, is an officer now facing a murder charge
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Among those who addressed protesters was Marcia Rigg, the sister of Sean Rigg
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He died in police custody at the entrance to Brixton police station in 2008 after a violent arrest
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Despite being clearly unwell, he had been handcuffed and left dying on the floor
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A police officer, filmed on CCTV, said that he was "faking it"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Christopher Alder died while in police custody at Queen's Gardens Police Station in Kingston upon Hull
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Having been taken to the station with a head injury, he was unresponsive
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: when he was dragged from a police van
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He lay on the floor of the custody suite for 11 minutes, CCTV footage shows, gasping for breath, with his hands cuffed behind him and his trousers round his ankles
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A pool of blood formed around his mouth
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Instead of being given medical attention, five police officers stood around commenting that he was "right as rain" and his agony was "just a show"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They even made monkey noises
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Four years earlier in 1994, Shiji Lapite died after being placed in a police van in east London
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A post-mortem found that Lapite had died of asphyxiation, suggesting that police officers had used a chokehold
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the inquest into his death recorded a verdict of unlawful killing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the Crown Prosecution Service declined to prosecute the officers involved
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: no officer has been convicted over a death in police custody since 1969
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the two Leeds police officers responsible for the death of David Oluwale, were found guilty of assault
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Negative experiences of police treatment are a consistent feature of the lives of many people, especially those who are young, black and come from the working class
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Families often suffer not just the initial news of the deaths of their loved ones in custody, but a concerted media campaign from the police smearing the reputations of the victim in the following weeks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The family of Mark Duggan weren't even informed of his death, instead finding out from TV news
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And these deaths represent only the worst and most painful cases of police violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many "lesser" incidents go virtually unreported
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even when these are recorded- as was a London police officer's threat that "if you say one more fucking word, I'll smash your fucking Arab face in" to a 16-year-old teenager in 2005- officers never face serious charges
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since the Macpherson report of 1999, which famously pointed to "institutional racism" within the Met, there has been little evidence of structural or far- reaching change in the way the police are held accountable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As in other European countries, especially France, anger at the police in the UK has repeatedly boiled over into riots
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The police killing of Duggan in 2011, which sparked the riots of that summer, is the clearest recent case
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Eighty-five percent of participants in those riots who were questioned by the Reading the Riots study said policing was an "important" or "very important" factor in why the riots happened
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: They pointed to long histories of being subjected to humiliating stop-and- searches and beatings by the police
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: who were often described as operating like a "gang"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The common view is that there is little point in attempting recourse via the official police complaint procedures
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This was confirmed by a recent investigation by Channel 4 Dispatches
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which showed that just one percent of allegations of racism by members of the public against the police in England and Wales were upheld over an eight year period
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: And yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: despite our knowledge that experiences of police violence have led to riots, the reaction of successive British governments has been to implement ever-harsher policing, especially in black and working-class communities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This coincides with a continued police clampdown in Muslim communities that has generated widespread anger for its methods, including the manufacture of evidence against Muslim suspects and long imprisonment periods for writing Facebook posts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We demonstrated on December 10 not only to show solidarity with those in the US, but also to point to the similar struggles for justice that we are facing here in the UK
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the late evening, dozens of protesters were corralled in the cold for over an hour before being arrested, loaded onto two buses commandeered for the purpose, and driven to various police stations around London
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Many were kept in the cold for hours before being led to holding cells
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Many were released miles from home in the very early morning
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There can be little doubt that this tactic of mass arrests, which is becoming more prominent, is aimed at dissuading future protest
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Those arrested are given "interview" dates well into the future - often with stringent bail conditions - and warned about commenting publicly before this date
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They are, as such, effectively gagged
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no small irony in this response to a demonstration about police violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But we have little intention of remaining silent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After decades of campaigning led by affected families, the movement for police accountability is developing new tactics and involving a growing number of young people who are determined to be the generation that sees change
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Along with our friends in the US, we adopt Garner's words to the police as our slogan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This stops today
paragraphs.label: assumption
